comments:
The launcher on linux looks for 'javaw.exe' instead of 'javaw' in the latest 
workspace (plugin export for integration build 20020312).

As a workaround, I made a link 'ln -s javaw javaw.exe' in my jre/bin directory.

Here's the log:

---8<---

Log: Tue Mar 12 15:29:53 CET 2002
4 org.eclipse.jdt.launching 150 Exception starting process.
java.io.IOException: /home/cknaus/eclipse/20020307-I/eclipse/jre/bin/javaw.exe: 
not found
	at java.lang.Runtime.execInternal(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:568)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:492)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMRunner.exec
(AbstractVMRunner.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner.run
(StandardVMRunner.java:222)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.launcher.WorkbenchLauncherDelegate.doLaunch
(WorkbenchLauncherDelegate.java:131)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.launcher.WorkbenchLauncherWizard.delegateLaunch
(WorkbenchLauncherWizard.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.launcher.WorkbenchLauncherWizard.access$0
(WorkbenchLauncherWizard.java:116)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.launcher.WorkbenchLauncherWizard$1.run
(WorkbenchLauncherWizard.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)

The code in StandardVMRunner.run which is supposed to handle this case was
reversed (doh!).

We were checking to see if a javaw or javaw.exe existed. If javaw existed, we'd
try to launch javaw.exe and vice versa.
